Message.Text: That man drains my will to live....
A new laptop, forummer of the week AND a new tribes game coming out. You must be in heaven.
Haha, AND I got my uni offers today
Nice.
AND I have carrot cake and tea
and mint slice biscuits!
Girl, got one of those?
The holidays are too good to me :P
Indeed
Winnin' all round!
I could loose 10 kegs, but hay, I can't have everything
Well, if you *lost* them then you'd have *less*... so it's all good, right? ;-)
Haha, exactly! Why have LESS when I can have MORE!
So who's making the new tribes game?
Plugs, Gilmore Girls have grasped there hold over me, and I'm right back into it (going through from season 1 again)
Garage Games
I hope to hell it's not... holy fuck, you're kidding me right?
Guys who made the engine and game,Tribes 2
Till they sold the IP to vivendi, and then decided to make another "reallynotTribes3" game :P
I know damn well who they are. We've been working with their engine and it's... well, let's say I'm not a huge fan. :-)
Haha, oh really?
Their engine is badly documented and full of holes. Some features are buggy, but - and here's the kicker - some features don't actually exist. They're features because you can add them yourself.

I was a fan with their older stuff because, while it wasn't perfect and it was still woefully underdocumented, it was at least fairly intuitive to use and did everything it said it did. But of late I'm not quite feeling the same way.
So are they using TGEA for Tribes 3?
I'm not sure, its built on there new web-based engine
o.O
but that may be a sort of port of the TGEA, just with a web based front end
Could be.
It looks very similiar, and the origanal prototype was to basically show of the TGEA
I know that there have been people working on web front-ends using the engine.
Or Torque: Shader engine as it was then
Don't get me wrong when I bag out Torque, it's great in quite a few ways.
It's just that some things about it drive me mad.
Haha, fare enough. Are you allowed to say what your doing with the Torque engine? Like are you developing your own game or some addons for it or that sorta thing?
Nope, can't say.
Wilco
I've used both TGE and TGEA.
TGE isn't as pretty, but to be honest I much preferred working with that over TGEA.
Really? I thought they basicaly just through some nice effects ontop of the origanal engine
That at least had a solid core and all the bolt-ons were on the outside. TGEA just feels patchwork inside to out to me.
After seeing a bunch of ports from TGE to TGEA in just a few months
Yeah, they did, but to do that they rewrote the whole renderer.
Which, due to a not particularly modular design, had code throughout the engine.
If a game is written mostly in Torquescript then it's easy to up-port.
I see...
So not as fun as doing everything from scratch then :P
TorqueScript is actually pretty good to work with.
There's obviously a fair bit of stuff that you should do in-engine for the sake of performance, but TorqueScript is very handy.
Good to know, I'm just looking forward to having a new Tribes game
I'd recommend TGE to indie developers who want to do stuff on the cheap without building their own engine.,
(Vengeance doesn't count)
I'm not sure I'd recommend TGEA unless newer, flashier graphics are really a must-have, though, because I just don't find it nearly as good to work with.
Yeah, I'd let you kick my butt at a new Tribes game.
Once, at least. ;-)
So did you know that Torque 2 is on the way?
lol I was never that great at Tribes, just in love
Umm, not really
Well, apparently it is. :-)
Not until at least late this year though.
And I'm unsure as to whether that's intended release or just the start of development.
TGEA was there big update though wasn't it, they had all those big "Milestone" releases and such

I'd really like a fresh new (ground up) Torque engine. I think that a lot of TGEA's problems are purely from the fact that it's not a new engine, it's an old one that's been dragged along kicking and screaming for the last... 9 years or something?
So is this a whole new overhaul, or just an interative update
A whole new engine, so I'm led to believe.
And yes, TGEA was a big thing. It brought Torque into the world of shaders.
Ah k, cool
Nice to have an insider :P
I wonder what the Renwerx guys are going to do
They were making there own tribes sucessor
http://www.ascension-game.com/
I'm not really an insider.
And Zod (the guy who made the Tribes 2: Clasic mod and most the T2 maps), was also working on his sorta game
I don't see why anything should happen.
Someone who knows what there talking about it instead of the "Just make Tribes 1 with better graphics" bunch from Tribalwar
As long as they're not using any copyrighted materials.
Renwerx have had a history of working on something for a year or two and then basicaly bailing and restarting else where
That's a bad habit to have.
Indeed,
One of those front page screenies is really good.
The one with the drone thingy flying around.
Of Ascension?
Yeah
Well, I presume.
On that site :-)
Yeah... I still put my faith in GG over a bunch of fellas on the internet who haven't come close to finishing a product since the renegades modes for Tribes 2

http://renwerx.com/blog-images/93712572644381440306610944316841.jpg

Z Brush

Probably god aweful

(I have the artistic talent of a brick.)
I consider myself more of a shovel...
Haha, well said.
So you can at least move your dirt around?
(On the odd occasion, somewhat useful...)
Good for burying dead pets with?
Good for burying bricks, no doubt. ;-)
Well, I'm off, Tea, carrot cake and the Gilmore Girls await me

Im just fooling around with some different objects to play with
Maybe I'll show you one of my recordings one day.
Crysis?
Nope.
oh?
You know I'm a programmer and work with 3D stuff, right?
I don't record other peoples' stuff. ;-)
I've worked out how to record it sucessfulyl frame by frame in the crysis editor and how to do the physics recording independant of the CPU
Awesome.
Any coding or scritping involved?
So that all the physics stuff is rendered almost like a propper animations program, 1-2fps
None at all
its quite simple
Aww, that's no fun.
Just takes a bit of getting used to
So how do you do it?
I'd imagine it'd be easy to code (set a fixed timestep and put a screencap command at the end of every render cycle) but without code... I haven't seen the editor so I can't really guess.
fixed timesteps can be set via the console
as can recording every frame
Ahh.
Well that's *sort of* coding... lol
lol I don't take any credit for it, its just fun watching stuff fall down
So how long does a recording take you then?
umm, Its a bit fiddy
Fiddly*
but, hour or so to get the hang of what your doing, 10 minutes or so to record the footage, 10 minutes compiling to xvid,
then i just converted it to mp4 to be small enough for youtube
10 minutes of footage goes to about 2 minutes of final rendered footage
Due to the framerates
Ouch, that's crazy.
But I'm recording at the highest settings
since if my computers going to be lagging, it may aswell look awesome

That one I just recorded them one after the other, I didn't stop the recording at all

so I'll cut everything together in a video editing program
you can tell when I reset to the editor mode again, everything reverts to how it was
